Reviews.Title: buyer be aware - only 90 days of service, not 1 year
Reviews.Author: Fabio
Reviews.Content: I was under the impression 1350 minute will last 1 year. I assume wrong. The card only add 90 service days to your phone. Look closely at the product technical info, 90 days,Once you used some of the minutes on the phone, you cannot return the phone.Another tracfone phone listed below does give you 1 year of service for 1200 minutes,http://www.amazon.com/LG-Prepaid-Minutes-Triple-Tracfone/dp/B00A6CH0QY/ref=pd_cp_cps_0

Reviews.Title: Good Deal
Reviews.Author: P. Brandt
Reviews.Content: With the exception of having to deal with Tracfone customer service in India which can cause enough frustration to make you regret ever getting it!

Reviews.Title: Not smart, but not dumb!
Reviews.Author: bigmac "bigmac"
Reviews.Content: All around Excellent value. It has a lot going for it. It's not an iPhone but it does get you lots of phone calls for little money. It also takes decent pics that you can send to your computer if it has bluetooth.....very handy.  You can also send them via the phone or connect to WiFi.  It also has a web browser.....very small screen so it comes in handy as a last resort. I just returned from a trip and used it  as an imput to my car radio for music that I had preloaded on it....played it for 5 hrs straight and Battery didn't go down. You can't go wrong with this one!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for the bucks...
Reviews.Author: Desi "jon"
Reviews.Content: Bought the LG 840G Tracphone for my wife who only uses a cell phone every now and again and asked me to find her an easy to understand simple to use cell phone! This phone fits the bill perfectly, It has enough apps to keep her happy including bluetooth, photo and music storage plus a carrier who covers most of the US and offers triple minutes for every top up! Would recommend this phone for someone who doesn't want to spend the big bucks on a smart phone but wants something that doesn't look like it was made in the 80's!

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: allan mcentire
Reviews.Content: this phone is great would recommend it to family and friends. The triple minutes plan makes me fill like im not getting ripped off.

Reviews.Title: lg 840g
Reviews.Author: Randy Q.
Reviews.Content: great phone with excellent reception.  live in st.louis and flew to denver.  great service all the way. easy to use and very reliable.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected
Reviews.Author: GFW
Reviews.Content: This TracFone was everything I expected from a cell phone for the price I paid. There are a few things I would like to have had but can live without for the price I paid and the excellent service I have received so far.

Reviews.Title: Not sound at all
Reviews.Author: Brenda Salazar
Reviews.Content: The LG 840G is a great phone when working well, but the one I ordered a few days ago didn't let me make calls (nobody can't hear my voice on the other side).  Not sound at all except with headphones,  neither Tracfone Company could fixed it by phone, had have to exchange it.  Hope to have another cell phone back in a few more days.

Reviews.Title: high quality cellphone with no huge monthly bill!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: mrdebjr
Reviews.Content: t,his is a topflight cellphone,large sensitive touch screen display,WI-FI,4G connectivity,all the features of three&four; hundred dollar cellphones,im very impressed with this communication device!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Would give it 0 stars if I could
Reviews.Author: Charlene
Reviews.Content: I have never had such awful service! I have a Tracfone and have service everywhere, but this one only works in around a ten-mile radius of my husband's work. What a joke! And the browser is useless for actually using the Internet. Waste of money. Customer service was no help, said that different phones have different servers. Should've had that on the box! We will be leaving Tracfone.

Reviews.Title: contract length
Reviews.Author: don shultz
Reviews.Content: The phone is fine, but you need to emphasize that the 1350 minutes is on a THREE MONTH contract. I think everyone, including me, thought it was a 12 month contract. Had I known, I would have purchased a different option.Don Shultz

Reviews.Title: Difficulties in accessing a specific name
Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: I have found that it is difficult to access a specific person when I wish to call them.  The touch screen seems to be very sensitive and often I find I'm calling someone I didn't want when just swiping my finger over the names to scroll for the one I want.

Reviews.Title: PHONE WORKS WELL FOR MY NEEDS
Reviews.Author: Vickie S.
Reviews.Content: GREAT PHONE ONLY WISH THE MINUTES WERE FOR A LONGER TIME AS I DO NOT USE TOO MANY IN A MONTH

Reviews.Title: LG840
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: This phone needs charging much more frequently than my previous phones. Now, I need to have charging implements available at all times.

Reviews.Title: happy with my purchase
Reviews.Author: kim-berly
Reviews.Content: I love the new phone. I've had a triple minute Tracfone for over a year. I dropped the previous phone with the slider keypad extended on a hard floor and talking on it was frustrating. So, I decided to get a different type of phone this time.It was easy to set up and learn how to use. I was surprised my text messages have more characters (up to 160 from 145). I thought that was set by the carrier.I was thrilled to find a Tracfone with so many minutes included. It was just $10 more than I pay for the 450/1350 minutes.I get the 450 triple minutes through Tracfone. I made one huge 1500/4500 minute 1 year purchase and decided I'd stick with the 450 minutes after that. Tracfone offers more minutes at a very reduced rate when you purchase from them, and I get those too and have 3750 minutes plus some bonus minutes (from bonus codes you can find on web) for around $155 dollars.The 450/1350 triple minutes are for 90 days. Tracfone offers a kinda insurance on it's site so you won't lose minutes. You only pay for it when you use it and so far I haven't need it. You can also buy 1 year of service so you won't lose your minutes. Each time you purchase minutes you extend you days of use.If you need a year of service get the other phone with 400/1200 minutes. This was the right deal for me!

Reviews.Title: tracfone
Reviews.Author: Stacy S.
Reviews.Content: This phone is great. I am not much of a cell phone user, but this one is perfect. My kids tease me because I now text them. Always buy a triple minute phone if you decide on tracfone.

Reviews.Title: LG 840G Prepaid Phone
Reviews.Author: Gene Mitchell
Reviews.Content: A great phone. A little slow, but over all a very nice phone. I'd recommend it. It's a keeper.Gene

Reviews.Title: The phone
Reviews.Author: astro "bear"
Reviews.Content: This is the phone I needed so far no problems and all service I don't know all that much about cell phone click but this one serves me well

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: This is a nice phone for the price. Not as good as an android or I-phone but good enough. Would recommend this phone. Screen is a bit touchy to work with at first but seems I have learned how to work with it pretty good now.

Reviews.Title: Good Cell Phone But Poor Choice of Minutes Because ...
Reviews.Author: John McPhee
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this good cell phone. Although there is little that distinguishes it in features or innovations, it offers solid quality and everything that I need, at a great price. It is not a smart phone. Moreover, Tracfone minutes saved me from being robbed by paying exorbitant prices for cell phone contracts. I had a terrible experience with one national company with its daily dropped calls, poor or unreliable reception, and constant billing errors. I will never return. Thankfully, now my needs are simple and my use is light. Tracfone offers a pay as you go, non-contractual arrangement that saves me a lot of money and aggravation. You can pay for either 3-month periods or for a year's worth of minutes. Unused minutes automatically carry over; they are not lost. I find it most convenient to purchase 12 months at a time.After I had determined that the LG 840G was the phone I wanted and that I would buy it with prepaid triple Tracfone minutes for life, I chose this item's package deal. However, I had a rude awakening. The 1350 minutes came with a 450 minute card (3 x 450 - triple minutes) BUT with only 3 months of service. You might use that many minutes in 3 months which means you would have no problems here. But this is simply my travel phone and that is far more minutes than I need for my average 12-month period. Unfortunately, I incorrectly assumed it was for a 12-month, not a 3-month period of service. Since I did not realize there was a problem before I opened the package and read the card itself, I could not return or exchange my item. I should add that the retailer, shopcelldeals, answered my concerns very quickly, was quite succinct, and business like.I was not upset because I was responsible for not being sufficiently thorough and careful. But could the product descriptions have been more clear? Yes. I too easily confused two offers that I falsely conflated because they are very, very similar but not the same. Please note the blue text link description below the phone's image for this product. It does not specify service term. If you are quickly browsing all you might notice is the minutes and associate so many minutes with a long term of service. Well over over a thousand minutes used in a relatively short period of time was counter-intuitive. If it was my primary phone I might think differently. In any case, I was wrong. I am clearly still responsible for my choice but possibly my experience could have been avoided. I will recommend a solution at the end of this review that could help others from making a similar mistake.My star rating reflects my assessment of this particular package in total (phone + card + service period). If the phone was sold separately I would rate it 4 stars. It does not deserve that as a total package with the card minutes for this particular service period. In my opinion, it is a poor choice and should be avoided especially when a better alternative is available. That is because the same company offered the same phone with a 400-minute card (3 x 400 = 1200 minutes total time) along with 12-months of service for the same amount of money when I bought mine. I also do not find recharging minutes at Tracfone to be a particularly easy or fast process. Therefore, today it is an easy choice for me: get the same phone, almost same minutes but get 9 more months of service for the same price instead. If that makes sense for your needs too consider buying this similar option package instead:  LG 840G Prepaid Phone With 1200 Minutes and Triple Minutes (Tracfone).I made a costly mistake but not a serious one. But clearly there was a better choice for many, perhaps not all, customers. The issue I underscore is not whether or not shoppers should be offered alternative deals but rather that the critical distinctions that differentiate them be as clear and transparent as possible. My product's package requires me to buy more minutes after 3 months instead of the second option's 12 months. I suspect I might have caught my mistake and realized there were two quite different terms for what superficially appeared to be the same package deal if the specific term in months was prominently included somewhere obvious like I have added to the end in the item's description in this part "... With 1350 Minutes and Triple Minutes, 12 Months Service, (Tracfone)".You could counter that more careful or observant shoppers than me would not need it spelled out so clearly and unambiguously. Yes, blush, mea culpa. But I believe that making shopping simpler and easier, especially on a customer first oriented site like Amazon, is never a bad idea. That is exactly in keeping with its business philosophy.
